meanings.definition: To shine brightly with flashes of light
meanings.sent1: The stars sparkle in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The water sparkles under the sun.
meanings.sent4: The diamond necklace sparkles like a thousand tiny stars.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks sparkle and light up the dark sky.

meanings.definition: A small flash or gleam of light
meanings.sent1: The little girl noticed a sparkle in the sand.
meanings.sent2: The diamond emitted a beautiful sparkle.
meanings.sent3: The sparkle of the fireflies enchanted the children.
meanings.sent4: The sparkle of the gem caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The morning dew added a magical sparkle to the grass.

meanings.sent1: Her eyes sparkle with excitement as she tells her story.
meanings.sent2: His jokes always sparkle and make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The party truly sparkled with fun and laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her personality sparkles with charm and charisma.
meanings.sent5: The conversation sparkled with interesting ideas and perspectives.

meanings.definition: A quality that makes someone or something seem lively and attractive
meanings.sent1: Her smile has a special sparkle that lights up the room.
meanings.sent2: The sparkle in his eyes reveals his enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The sparkle in her personality draws people towards her.
meanings.sent4: The sparkle in the performance captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The sparkle in the design made it stand out from the rest.
